topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536200726368723d730e0100#post_536200726368723d730e0100
Show hidden files.  If there's a bunch of hidden files don't touch it.  Chances are there's a bunch of hidden files.  If it's not say your documents or such you probably shouldn't touch it.  If it's your documents, pictures or music file that's fine to shift delete.  If it's a bunch of copypasta file names that potentially is what you're looking for.

You should just say fuck it and just turn it in to get repaired.  At this point the "fuck it" option is probably better cause there's probably a bunch of serious problems with your computer.  It could be anything from corrupted installation to broken dll to hardware failure.

You should probably go with the "fuck it" option and just turn it in to get repaired cause this is one of those serious problems that sure I could fix if I was there, but telling you over the internet is far more difficult to do.  Without the serial key you're going to have to send it in for repairs anyhow so it's time to say, "fuck it" and just get it repaired.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Okay one more post before I go to bed:
Continuing on from the previous page post about steamos; there will never be a virus for linux distros ever so you don't need to worry about this.  Why?  Cause _most_ actual hackers and not script kiddies use linux.  The second a actual hacker goes, "I made a virus for linux go me!" his 23 friends would immediately stab him to death out of rage that he made such a thing and his last words would be "et tu brute".

If you create a virus for linux you're going to piss a lot of people off that can within seconds ruin your life forever.  Creating a virus for linux is a outright literal death sentence.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
So apparently tv is officially dying now.

Short version is stuff we've already know for ages, people that have netflix and hulu are more likely to stop watching cable, younger people are more likely to watch shows online.

Don't ask me to crunch the numbers of when it's going to die, cause my TI-83's batteries are dead and I don't feel like solving it the old fashion way.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536315d96368720b300a0000#post_536315d96368720b300a0000
The thing is, Japan is beginning to lay the groundwork for 8k TV which that want to have by 2020. If TV is going nowhere, then you can say good bye to super fast bandwidth and 8k TV's.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5363183763687245a71c0000#post_5363183763687245a71c0000
After doing it the painful way I figured it out; 15 to 30 years.  30 years if cable companies behave like calm rational adults who realize that times change and that they need to adapt to changes in technology.  15 years if they just utterly flip the fuck out and their gut kneejerk reaction is to shoot themselves in the foot thinking that will work.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
